decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: A-1000(P02), A-1001(P01), A-1050(P01), A-2050(P02) & Detailed Lighting Design & Lighting Impact Assessment Report (RevA) dated 9th August 2023.

Condition : 3 - The floodlighting hereby permitted relates to the Astro Turf only (identified in approved drawing No. A-1001(P01)) and shall only be used between the hours of 07:30 and 21:00 Monday to Friday, 15:30 and 18:00 on Saturdays, and at no other time.

Reason: To protect the amenities of local residents and ensure compliance with policy DM EP2 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan and Policies Maps (July 2014).

Condition : 4 - The recommendations specified in the approved Detailed Lighting Design & Lighting Impact Assessment Report (RevA) dated 9th August 2023 shall be implemented as a minimum standard, with floodlighting positioned and angled to prevent any light spillage or glare to any adjoining residential properties. The floodlighting shall also comply with the Institute of Lighting Professionals� �Guidance notes for the reduction of obtrusive light�, and a post completion lighting assessment to ensure compliance shall be undertaken and submitted to the LPA for written approval within 6 months of first use. The approved details shall be permanently retained thereafter. 

Reason: To protect the amenities of local residents and ensure compliance with policy DM EP2 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan and Policies Maps (July 2014).

Condition : 5 - The use of the floodlighting is permitted for a maximum of 10 minutes beyond the permitted use times whilst set on Amenity Lighting Mode.

Reason: To protect the amenities of local residents and ensure compliance with policy DM EP2 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan and Policies Maps (July 2014).

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
description: INSTALLATION OF REPLACEMENT FLOODLIGHTS ON MULTI-USE GAMES AREA
